pageContext.claim: “I said to Sonny Perdue, Department of Agriculture -- secretary of Agriculture -- 'Sonny, what's the most money that China has ever paid toward agriculture, toward buying food product?' He said $15 billion a number of years ago.I said 'Is that the most?' He said 'Yes.' Some people will say close to [Inaudible] but $15 billion was about the most. I said 'Good. I'm going to take $15 billion out of the $100 billion, and I'm going to give that to our farmers.'”
pageContext.analysis: China purchased nearly $20 billion in agricultural products from U.S. farmers in 2017, but purchases fell sharply because of Trump's tariffs. The actual record was significantly higher -- $29.6 billion in the 2014 fiscal year, according to the Department of Agriculture.
